title: How to Paint by Number

steps.headline: Purchase a Paint-By-Number set.
steps.description: Pick one that you really like to increase the chances that you'll finish it. Sets come in many different varieties of subject matter: birds, flowers, seaside scenes, woodland scenes, cartoon characters, automotive themes.

steps.headline: Clear an area to work in.
steps.description: Cover the area with old newspapers or newsprint to keep it clean. If you can station this area in a room with a washable floor, that would be most beneficial.

steps.headline: Get a cup of water with which to clean your brush.
steps.description: Use a cup you don't usually drink from or one that can be washed thoroughly. A paper cup is fine. Disposable food containers also work well, for example, a used yogurt container. Also, stock the area with some rags.

steps.headline: Read the directions on the box.
Check to see which colors correspond to which numbers.
steps.description: This should be clearly marked on the paint containers.

steps.headline: Open the first paint container and paint every area marked with that number.
Wash your brush off when you finish to avoid accidentally mixing colors.
steps.description: The rag will come in handy as you will need to remove some of the water from the brush after washing.

steps.headline: Let the areas you have painted dry.
steps.description: Repeat with a new color until you have painted every area and the painting is totally dry.

steps.headline: Display your end masterpiece.
steps.description: If you like how your painting turned out, frame your creation or mat it, and hang it on your wall.
